title: Pablo Melgar
text:
Pablo Sebastián Melgar Torino (born January 14, 1980) is a retired <a href="Guatemala">Guatemala</a>n-<a href="Chile">Chile</a>an <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> <a href="defender%20%28football%29">defender</a>.
Club career.
Before playing in Chile, Melgar played for local clubs <a href="Deportivo%20Zacapa">Deportivo Zacapa</a>, <a href="Antigua%20GFC">Antigua GFC</a>, <a href="Aurora%20F.C.">Aurora F.C.</a>, and <a href="CSD%20Municipal">Municipal</a>, the latter from 2004 to 2007, during which time the club won five <a href="Liga%20Nacional%20de%20Guatemala">league titles</a> in a row. He then left Municipal for <a href="Club%20de%20Deportes%20Antofagasta">Antofagasta</a> but decided not to return to Chile after finding it hard to play football outside the capital, <a href="Santiago%20de%20Chile">Santiago de Chile</a>. After a stint with <a href="Universad%20de%20San%20Carlos%20%28Guatemalan%20football%20club%29">USAC</a>, Melgar returned to Municipal for the Apertura 2010 season.
International career.
Melgar has been a regular on the <a href="Guatemala%20national%20football%20team">Guatemala national team</a>, for which he has competed at the youth, <a href="Football%20at%20the%20Summer%20Olympics">Olympic</a>, and full international levels. Tournaments in which he partaked include the <a href="FIFA%20U-17%20World%20Cup">under-17</a> and <a href="FIFA%20U-20%20World%20Cup">under-20 World Cup</a> qualifying, the <a href="1999%20Pan%20American%20Games">1999 Pan American Games</a>, the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202000%20Summer%20Olympics">2000 Olympic tournament</a> qualifying and the Central American Games of 2002.
He made his senior debut in a January 2002 friendly match against <a href="Cuba%20national%20football%20team">Cuba</a> and has earned a total of 56 caps (including a non official game against <a href="Argentina%20national%20football%20team">Argentina</a>), scoring 1 goal. He has represented his country in 16 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and played at the <a href="UNCAF%20Nations%20Cup">2003 UNCAF Nations Cup</a> and the <a href="2005%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2005</a> and <a href="2007%20CONCACAF%20Gold%20Cup">2007 CONCACAF Gold Cup</a>s.
